metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7447 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the gdk_cairo_set_source_pixbuf function in gdk/gdkcairo.c in GTK+ before 3.9.8, as used in eom, gnome-photos, eog, gambas3, thunar, pinpoint, and possibly other applications, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a large image file, which triggers a large memory allocation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eog - 3.10.2-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

gir1.2-gtk-2.0 - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
gtk2-engines-pixbuf - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
gtk2.0-examples - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
libgail-common - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
libgail18 - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
libgtk2.0-0 - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
libgtk2.0-bin - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
libgtk2.0-common - 2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

gir1.2-gtk-3.0 - 3.10.8-0ubuntu1.6
gtk-3-examples - 3.10.8-0ubuntu1.6
libgail-3-0 - 3.10.8-0ubuntu1.6
libgtk-3-0 - 3.10.8-0ubuntu1.6
libgtk-3-bin - 3.10.8-0ubuntu1.6
libgtk-3-common - 3.10.8-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eog package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10.2-0ubuntu5.1').
gambas3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gnome-photos: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gtk+2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24.23-0ubuntu1.4').
gtk+3.0 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.8-0ubuntu1.6').
pinpoint: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunar: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
